name: Dynamic Dental Edu.
about: Sole developer and designer on a team of four to conceptualize and develop a comprehensive dental test prep platform.
details: It features an intuitive frontend and full CMS, with an OAuth2-secured API.

name: Chinese RPG
about: Designing a web adventure game that facilitates language learning through well-defined heuristics.
details: Completed two rounds of beta testing at public schools and am now implementing feedback.

name: Alexa Voice Shopping
about: Prototype of an online voice-enabled shopping experience using the Amazon Echo.
details: Contact me to set up a demo through https://echosim.io/

name: Viewers to Volunteers
about: Frontend developer on a $1.5m social media site for CBS which promotes community outreach.
details: This project was particularly meaningful for me as volunteerism has played a pivotal role in my life. Ask about it :)

name: Fuzz Productions Site
about: Lead developer on Fuzz company website frontend/backend overhaul.

name: Speech App
about: Foreign language Speech app to manipulate, narrate, and translate content on the fly.
details: Built custom lexers to break up sentence structure into meaningful parts.

name: Alexa-Slack Office Assistant
about: Add commands, such as lunch for the week or employee status, through Slack, which can be communicated through the Amazon Echo.
details: For example: "Alexa, what is lunch for tomorrow?".

name: Fuzz Labs Blog
about: Fully customized CMS and API to share Fuzz's latest technical experiments.
details: I helped with frontend and API development, such as tagging, markdown, and image uploading support.

name: Rummy
about: Recreated one of my favorite card games with Raphael JS for fun and to demo new tech.
details: Features full AI and winning/losing/invalid hand simulations.

name: Interactive Algorithms
about: A work in progress, I've started recreating animated algorithms to help myself and others understand their complexities.
details: Currently features BFS/DFS tree traversal, and a partially working A* Path Finder (something quite useful in my Chinese game).

name: Hitting Trees with Sticks
about: How I got my start into all of this... My baby- a vanilla PHP comics and artwork website.
details: I created this in 2012 to share my comics with the world, and gained 45k fans on Facebook.

name: Shake Shack
about: As my first Python and Django project, I contributed to CMS and Django Rest Framework API development.
